message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.MM

The paper discusses the integration of human behavioral, psychological, and socio-economic contexts in the design of human-centric communications. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) category. Additionally, the paper proposes the use of the prospect theory, which is a methodology for modeling human psychology, and this could fall under the Cybernetics (cs.CY) and Signal Processing (cs.SI) categories. The paper also discusses the implications of the prospect theory for information theory, which could place it under the Information Theory (cs.IT) category. Finally, the paper could also be relevant to the Multimedia (cs.MM) category, as human-centric communications often involve multimedia content.
